Title: surimono / print

Title: triptych print
Description: Woodblock print, triptych. Kabuki. Actor Matsumoto Koshiro as Gihei from Chushingura on box, Bando Mitsugoro with Otani Hiroemon as ronin with sword, sandal. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: print

Title: painting

Trimmed. Inscribed and signed.

Inscribed, signed and marked.

Title: Seiro niwaka onna geisha no bu ・・・・･ｼ・ｻ・・・・・・・・･ｳ・・ｸ・・・ｹ・・・ｨ (Female Geisha Section of the Yoshiwara Niwaka Festival) / Tojin, shishi, sumo ・・・・ｺｺ・・・・・ｭ・・・ｧ・・・・ (Korean, Lion Dancer, Sumo Wrestler)

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Painting, hanging scroll. Courtesan wearing white short-sleeved kimono decorated with all-over tie-dyed pattern of white circles, and bright blue obi belt with design of interlocking plant tendrils in gold; walking while her left hand placed inside kimono and right hand pulling up skirt at front; ends of her hair swept up and knotted to form loop. Ink, colour and gold on paper. Signed and sealed.

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Kakemono. General subject - figure, legend. Girl dreaming of Ise monogatari. Ink and colours on silk.

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Kakemono. General subject - deity. 7 Gods of good luck at Enoshima. Ink and colours on silk.

Title: Aburaya Osome, Kogai Hisamatsu・・ｲｹ・ｱ・・・・・・・・・ｰ・・・・・・・・ｹ・・・ｾ (Aburaya Osome and Kogai Hisamatsu) / Chiwa kagami tsuki no murakumo・・・・・ｩｱ・・｡・・・・・ｮ・・・・・ｲ (Models of Love-talk: Clouds Form over the Moon)
Description: Colour woodblock print. Old man reading letter; lovers Osome and Hisamatsu, whispering behind his back and communicating by hand gestures. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and marked.

Description: Kakemono. General subject - landscape. Mount Fuji. Colours on silk. According to the catalogue, signed and seal.

Description: Kakemono. General subject - figure. Yoritomo on horse, with samurai attendant holding umbrella, and warrior with club. Colours on silk. According to the catalogue, signed and seal.

Ichikawa Danjuro VII as Benkei, making love to an unidentified female impersonator as Ushiwaka-maru, as the latter looks at an erotic picture. Benkei's weapons lie on the ground to one side. Title: Ehon haikai yobuko-dori ・ｼ・・・ｬ・・・・・・・､・・ｩｦ・ｭ・・・・ (Haikai Book of the Cuckoo (or Worshipping a Woman's Pussy at Night))

Title: mitate-e / painting / hanging scroll
Description: Hanging scroll. Girls representing Xu You and Chao Fu. Ink and colours on paper.

Title: Eon Hoshi・・・ｵ・・ｩ・・ｳ・ｭ・ (The Priest Huiyuan) / Kokei ni sansho・・・・・・ｯ・・・・ｹ・・ｸ・・ｬ・ (Three Laughers at Children's Playful Spirits)

Title: Nihonbashi yuki-bare・・･・・ｬ・ｩ・・・ｪ・・ｴ (Fine Weather after Snow at Nihonbashi) / Edo meisho mitsu no nagame ・ｱ・・・ｸ・・・・・・ｸ・・・､・・ｮ・・ｺ (Three Views of Famous Places in Edo)

Description: Colour woodblock print. Seventh composition of twelve designs. Yuranosuke holding fan in mouth and helping Okaru down from ladder. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed, sealed and marked.

Description: Colour woodblock print. Second composition of twelve designs. Oboshi Rikiya, meeting with his sweetheart Konami and handing over sword; Honzo watching over the pair from behind sliding door. Inscribed, signed, sealed and marked.

Description: Woodblock. Classical literature. Act III, O-Karu repulsing the Bannai's embrace, Kampei, her lover, appearing from behind wall. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: print
Description: Colour woodblock print. Side view of large head of actor Ichikawa Ebizo in shibaraku role, wearing: 'five-spoke wheel' wig with white paper 'strength' decorations under black lacquer court hat; fierce red make-up; green jacket with white stylised crane pattern; sleeve of persimmon-coloured over-costume decorated with three white interlocking squares of Ichikawa family emblem. Title: Nakamura Nakazo II as Matsuomaru, Kataoka Nizaemon VII as Shihei, Ichikawa Yaozo III as Umeomaru and Nakamura Noshio II as Sakuramaru ・ｺ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｻｲ・・・・ｸｭ・・ｵ・・ｮ・・ｾ・・・・ｸｸ, ・ｸ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・・・・ｲ｡・ｻ・・ｷｦ・｡・・・・・ｮ・・・・ｹｳ, ・ｸ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｸ・・ｷ・・・ｫ・・ｾ・・ｵ・・ｮ・｢・・・・・ｸｸ・・ｨ・ｺ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｻｲ・・・・・ｮ・・・・・ｻ・・ｮ・｡・・ｸｸ
Description: Woodblock print.Music, dance and drama. Characters from Joruri play Tenjinki, Shihei in a chariot, casting spell over Umeo and Sakura-maru, and Matsuo. Four of five sheets. Nishiki-e on paper.  Part A.

Title: Ryuko yakusha Suikoden goketsu hyakuhachinin no hitori ・ｵ・・｡・・ｽｹ・・・ｰｴ・ｻｸ・・ｳ・ｱｪ・・・・・ｾ・・ｫ・ｺｺ・ｸ・・ / Matsumoto Koshiro as Akushichibyoe Kagekiyo ・・ｾ・・ｬ・ｹｸ・・・・・・・・ｮ・・ｪ・ｸ・・・ｵ・｡・・・ｯ・ｸ・

Description: Scenes of leisured life. Ink and colours on paper.

Description: Woodblock print. Shunga. Man making love to six women, possibly a parody of the Seven Gods of Good Luck.

Title: Koshu Isawa akatsuki ・・ｲ・ｷ・・ｼ・・ｲ｢・・・ (Dawn at Isawa in Kai Province) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. View of Mt Fuji from north at dawn at Isawa: Travellers in deep round hats crowding road and making preparations for early departure: loading pack-horses and shouldering carrying poles; Fuefuki River behind inns, crossed by bridge on far right. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed and signed.

Title: Tokaido Ejiri Tago-no-ura ryakuzu ・・ｱ・ｵｷ・・・・ｱ・・ｰｻ・・ｰ・ｭ・・・ｮ・ｵｦ・・･・・ｳ (Simplified View, Tago Beach, [near] Ejiri on the Tokaido Highway) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)

Nishiki-e on paper. Trimmed on all sides. Inscribed and signed.

Title: No 16 Yoshiwara, hidari Fuji ・・・・・・・ｷｦ・ｯ・・｣ｫ (Yoshiwara: Fuji on the Left) / Tokaido gojusan-tsugi no uchi ・・ｱ・ｵｷ・・・・ｺ・・・ｾ・ｸ・・ｬ｡・ｹ・・・・ (Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Highway)

Description: Woodblock print, oban tate-e. Grafitti characters of seven kabuki actors: Bando Hikosaburo IV (top right), Bando Mitsugoro IV (bottom right), Onoe Matsusuke III (top centre), Fujikawa Kayu III (centre), Otani Tomoemon IV (top left), Nakamura Gennosuke II (centre left), Azuma Tozo V (bottom left).

Title: Hanawa Daimyﾅ・jin go-shintai ・・ｱ・ｼｪ・､ｧ・・・・･・・・・・･・・ｽ・ no14 (Manifestation of the Great Deity Hanawa, no. 14)
Description: Painting, shikishi. The deity Fudo Myoo seated on a rock by a waterfall, with a young girl climbing towards him. Ink and colour on board.

Title: Barber's Shop, Koyasuhama
Description: Woodblock print. Barber's shop in Koyasuhama. Colours. Annotations and seal.

Title: triptych print
Description: Colour woodblock-printed triptych. Tenno Festival: great street procession outside Tenno shrine in Edo; two floats of lion-dogs carried by bearers in centre; tree covered in devotional prayer-slips in left; sake barrels in right. Inscribed, signed, sealed and marked.

Title: (Santo yakusha) Masukagami (・ｸ・・・ｽ・ｿｳ・・ｪ) ・・ｾ・・・・・・・・・・・ｿ (Mirror-perfect Reflections of Actors in the Three Cities)
Sensu seiran ・・・・ｭ・・・ｴ・ｵ・ (Clearing Storm of the Folding Fan) / Furyu zashiki hakkei ・｢ｨ・ｵ・・ｺｧ・・ｷ・・ｫ・・ｯ (Eight Fashionable Views of Interiors)
Description: Shunga. (Eight Elegant Parlour Views).(Clearing Storm of the Folding Fan). Fan seller and woman on a verandah, with a small boy playing with water from a goldfish tank. Woodblock-printed. Inscribed.

Title: shunga / print
Description: Shunga. Lovers with a baby. Yellow ground. Woodblock-printed

Title: Flower, bird, wind, and moon (・・ｱ・ｳ･・｢ｨ・・・). Tori-oi and Daikagura street performers (・ｳ･・ｿｽ・・・・・ｨ・､ｪ・･・・･ｽ)
Description: Woodblock print.Music, dance and drama. Street-entertainer. Poem. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: Karasaki ya-u ・・・・ｴ・・､・・・ｨ (Night Rain at Karasaki) / Omi hakkei no uchi ・ｿ・・ｱ・・・ｫ・・ｯ・ｹ・・・・ (Eight Views of Lake Biwa)
Description: Woodblock. General subject - townscape, urban, classical series. Night rain at Karasaki with the ancient pine green.1 of 2. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: Ichikawa Yaozo II as Oyamada hyakusho Yomosaku (・ｺ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｸ・・ｷ・・・ｫ・・ｾ・・ｵ・・ｮ・ｰ・・ｱｱ・・ｰ・・ｾ・ｧ・・ｸ・・・・・ｽ・)
Description: Woodblock print. Kabuki. Actor Ichikawa Yaozo as farmer Oyamada looking at reflection in water pail, compared to handbill likeness. Inscription. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: triptych print
Description: Colour woodblock print triptych. Newly published brocade first night: Audience arriving at Kabuki theatre; three women on right wearing hair-cloths; man carrying boxes of noodles on left; two doormen standing with fans advertising appearance of Danjuro (left) and Sojuro (right); performance glimpse through entrance. 1 of 2 impressions. Inscribed and signed.

Title: print
Description: Colour woodblock print. Bijinga. Ofuji handing over handscroll to Okita. Nishiki-e on paper. Signed, sealed and marked.

Title: Matsumoto Koshiro IV as Shigetada(?) and Ichikawa Monnosuke II as Atake Dainichibo(?) ・・・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・・ｾ・・ｬ・ｹｸ・・・・・・・・ｮ・・・・ｿ(?)・・ｨ・ｺ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｸ・・ｷ・・・・ｹ・・・ｩ・・ｮ・・・・・・・・・・､ｧ・・･・・・(?)

Description: Woodblock print.Music, dance and drama.  Girl dancing the nuno-zarashi dance with two silken streamers. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: kakemono-e
Description: Colour woodblock print with some hand-colouring, ishizuri-e. Dragon and tige with clouds and sea and tiger with bamboo. Signed.

Title: triptych print
Description: Colour woodblock-printed triptych. Picnic on beach: Young men and women of daimyo class serving sake from lacquered picnic set on beach; fishermen bring in their catch in background. Signed, marked and sealed.

Title: mitate-e / diptych print
Description: Colour woodblock-printed diptych, mitate-e. Seven Edo courtesans and entertainers, with their attendants; one reading love-letter; in garden on outskirts of city, a parody of the Seven Sages of the Bamboo Grove. Signed, sealed and marked.

Title: Seiobo Ogiya uchi Takikawa, Onami, Menami・・･ｿ・・・・ｯ・・・・・・ｱ・・・・・ｻ・・ｷ・・・・・・・ｪ・・ｿ・・・・・・ｪ・・ｿ (Seiobo: Takikawa of the Ogiya, [kamuro:] Onami, Menami) / Enchu hassen・・・ｶ・ｸｭ・・ｫ・ｻ・ (Eight Immortals in the Art of Love)
Description: Colour woodblock print. Courtesan Takikawa as Seiobo, Chinese fairy queen; kamuro holding peaches; with Chinese style fan and incense-burner. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed, sealed and marked.

Title: triptych print
Description: Colour woodblock-printed triptych. Scene from play 'An Example of Noble Womanhood': Kogonosuke standing on far bank gazing at his lover Hinadori; Hinadori standing on near veranda; palace in style of contemporary Edo house of entertainment with cherry-blossom in garden. Signed, sealed and marked.

Title: Rosei kantan issui no yume ・ｭｯ・・・・ｶ・ｽｭ・ｸ・・・・､｢ (Lu Sheng's Transient Dream at Handan)
Description: Colour woodblock-printed triptych, mitate-e. Parody of Lu Sheng's (J: Rosei) dream, here dreaming of the pleasures of contemporary Edo (Tokyo) at Shinagawa: Greeting sunrise in boat on Edo Bay, feasting in restaurant, being entertained to classical music; joining procession of top-rank courtesan under cherry-blossom. Inscribed, signed and marked.

Title: Taiko gosai rakuto yukan no zu・・､ｪ・・､・ｺ・・ｦｻ・ｴ・・・ｱ・・・・ｦｳ・ｹ・・・ｳ (Picture of Hideyoshi and his Five Wives Viewing the Cherry-blossom at Higashiyama)
Description: Colour woodblock-printed triptych. Toyotomi Hideyoshi at flower-viewing party with his wife (Kita no Mandokoro), concubines (Lady Kana, Lady Sanjo, Ishida Mitsunari, Lady Matsu no Maru, Okoi-no-kata, Lady Yodo) and attendants. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and marked.

Title: Ichikawa Komazo III as Ono Sadakuro ・ｸ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｸ・・ｷ・・ｫ・・ｺ・・・ｵ・・ｮ・・ｧ・ｮ・・ｹ・・・・

Description: Woodblock. General subject - landscape, rural, classical series. Night rain at Karasaki.Boats,trees.1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: triptych print
Description: Woodblock, triptych. History, myth and legend. The revenge of the Taira ghosts on Yoshitsune and his men in Daimotsu bay.Inscription. Nishiki-e on paper.

Poems above by Hatsukuni and Chikakuni; signed.

Left sheet: Ichikawa Ebijuro I as Kazusanosuke Hirotsune, Arashi Kitsusaburo I as Abe no Yasunari. Inscribed, signed, publisher's mark.

Title: print

Nishiki-e on paper.

Description: Colour woodblock print. Oath in peach orchard from Chinese novel 'San guo zhi yan yi'; triple bust portrait of: Liu Bei in centre at top; Guan Yu on right; Zhang Fei on left; pledging friendship with cup of wine. Nishiki-e on paper. Signed and marked.

Title: Fumi no kiyogaki ・ｩｦ・ｾ・・・ｮ・ｸ・・・ｸ・・・ (Neat Version of a Love Letter (or Pure Drawings of Female Beauty))
Description: Album of eleven erotic colour woodblock prints (from a series of twelve), some designs after the 'Utamakura' of Utamaro.

Title: Negai no itoguchi ・・ｭ・・・・・・・・ｮ・ｳｸ・・｣ (Threads Leading to Desire)
Description: Shunga. Lovers in front of a screen of red and white plum. Woodblock-printed

Title: Mane'emon no. 9 ・・ｾ・・ｭ・・ｸ・・・・・・・ｹ・ / Furyu enshoku Mane'emon ・｢ｨ・ｵ・・・ｶ・・ｲ・・・・ｼｼ・・・・・・・・・ (Elegant Amorous Mane'emon)
Description: Shunga. Woman traveller on horseback making love to the groom. Woodblock-printed. Inscribed.

Title: Mane'emon no. 7 ・・ｾ・・ｭ・・ｸ・・・・・・・ｸ・ / Furyu enshoku Mane'emon ・｢ｨ・ｵ・・・ｶ・・ｲ・・・・ｼｼ・・・・・・・・・ (Elegant Amorous Mane'emon)
Description: Colour woodblock print, shunga. Old farmer kissing his wife, while a young couple make love in the room within. Inscribed.

Title: Sanka hakuu ・ｱｱ・ｸ・・・ｽ・・ｨ (Rainstorm Beneath the Summit) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: COMPASS Title: Katsushika Hokusai, 'Rainstorm Beneath the Summit' (Sanka haku'u), a colour woodblock print;Katsushika Hokusai, 'Rainstorm Beneath the Summit' (Sanka haku'u), a colour woodblock print

Title: Joshu Ushibori ・ｸｸ・ｷ・・・・・・・ (Ushibori in Hitachi Province) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Woodblock. General subject - landscape, rural, classical series. Boat among reeds,Fuji beyond.1 of 2. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: Tokaido Kanaya no Fuji ・・ｱ・ｵｷ・・・・・・・ｰｷ・・・・ｸ・・ｺ・ (Fuji from Kanaya on the Tokaido Highway) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. View at Oi River: Freight and palanquins ferried on rafts by teams of loin-clothed 'river-crossers'; individual travellers carried on bare shoulders, legs held up forwards out of water; Mt Fuji in distance. 1 of 3 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed, sealed and marked.

Title: Shojin tozan ・ｫｸ・ｺｺ・・ｻ・ｱｱ (Groups of Mountain Climbers) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Final design of series. Pilgrims in white jackets making way to cave on Mt Fuji at sunrise: some bracing themselves with wooden staffs as clambering over rocks; others pausing to rest and huddling together in cave. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: Onden no suisha ・・・・ｰ・ｹ・・ｰｴ・ｻ・ (Waterwheel at Onden) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Two men ascending slope carrying sacks of grain; two women next to mill-race, holding wooden bucket and washing leaves in basket; young boy with pet terrapin on string glancing at view; Mt Fuji in distance. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: Shinshu Suwa-ko ・ｿ｡・ｷ・・ｫ・・ｨｪ・ｹ・ (Lake Suwa in Shinano Province) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. View from north of Lake Suwa, looking south-east towards distant Mt Fuji: Small shrine building beneath pine trees in foreground; Takashima castle on left shore; single fishing boat crossing lake. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: Tokaido Hodogaya ・・ｱ・ｵｷ・・・・ｨ・・・ｶ・ｰｷ (Hodogaya on the Tokaido Highway) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Travellers on road lined with pine trees at Hodogaya: foot-traveller on far right with itinerant monk, deep sedge hat and bamboo flute, gazing at roadside stone image of deity carved into rock-face of hillside; palanquin bearers resting to mop brow and re-tie sandal; man leading horse pointing herding stick towards Mt Fuji in background. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and marked.

Title: Soshu Nakahara ・・ｸ・ｷ・・ｻｲ・・・ (Nakahara in Sagami Province) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Local people and travellers at bridge over small river: pedlar with load and furled umbrella, mendicant pilgrim with ringed staff and portable shrine, farmer with bird rattle, woman loaded with baby, hoe, spade and bundles and boxes in shallow wooden basin on head on bridge, fisherman with scoop-basket standing in shallows, two pilgrims approaching bridge; roadside stone statue of deity Fudo; bird-scarers strung between poles on strings; Mt Fuji in background. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed, sealed and marked.

Title: Edo Suruga-cho Mitsui mise ryakuzu ・ｱ・・・ｸ・ｧｿ・ｲｳ・・ｺ・ｸ・・ｺ・・ｦ・・ｸ・・・･・・・ (Rough Impression of the Mitsui Shop in Suruga-cho, Edo) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Woodblock. Townscape. Rough impression of the Mii shopping centre in Surugacho.1 of 2. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: Tokaido Shinagawa Goten-yama no Fuji ・・ｱ・ｵｷ・・・・・・・ｷ・・ｾ｡・ｮｿ・ｱｱ・・・・ｸ・・ｺ・ (Fuji from Goten-yama, at Shinagawa on the Tokaido Highway) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. View of Mt Fuji across Sagami Bay, between trunks of cherry trees dotted hills at Goten-yama above Shinagawa: Samurai and ordinary townspeople with children, picnicking and cavorting under blossoms, taking refreshment at temporary tea-stalls. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: No 17 Yui, Satta-mine ・・ｱ・ｺ・・・ｩ・・ｵ・ｶｺ (Yui: Satta Peak) / Tokaido gojusan-tsugi no uchi ・・ｱ・ｵｷ・・・・ｺ・・・ｾ・ｸ・・ｬ｡・ｹ・・・・ (Fifty-Three Stations of the Tokaido Highway)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Three tiny figures at vantage point high on pass: woodcutter trudging with large load; other two travellers gazing and gesticulating towards white Mt Fuji on horizon across Suruga Bay; ships in Bay and trees on cliff. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: Koshu Mishima-goe ・・ｲ・ｷ・・ｸ・・ｶ・・ｶ・ (Mishima Pass in Kai Province) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Three travellers stretching out arms and trying to encircling massive tree; Mt Fuji in background with summer thunder clouds around slopes and more clouds above summit. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: Ju Senju kagai yori chobo no Fuji ・ｾ・・・・・ｽ・・・ｱ・｡・・・ｺ・・・・・・・ｸ・・ｺ・ (Fuji Seen in the Distance from Senju Pleasure Quarter) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Procession of 'alternate attendance' passing Senju in autumn: Gun-carriers' muskets sheathed in red cases; decorated tips of the spear-bearers' weapons behind trees; sandals hanging under eaves at roadside tea-stall straw; two women seated on raised path through harvested fields; Mt Fuji covered with snow in distance. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed and signed.

Title: Soshu Umezawa-zai ・・ｸ・ｷ・・｢・・ｾ､・ｷｦ (Umezawa Manor in Sagami Province) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Clouds of pink-tinted morning mist parting to reveal a blue Fuji; group of five cranes feeding in foreground; another pair flying up into sky in parallel with long slope of mountain. 1 of 3 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: Koishikawa yuki no ashita ・､ｫ・ｷ・・・ｪ・・・・・ｦ (Morning after a Snowfall at Koishikawa) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Morning after heavy fall of snow: Customers gathering at window of restaurant for elegant Fuji-viewing party; waitress bringing in large tray of food; one woman pointing finger towards three birds circling emptied sky; neighbouring roofs and Mt Fuji in distance covered with snow. 1 of 3 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: Sunshu Ejiri ・ｧｿ・ｷ・・ｱ・・ｰｻ (Ejiri in Suruga Province) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Figures and trees on path through marsh, battling wind in foreground: Stream of paper tissues, trevalling-hat and leaves blown off in sky by wind; Mt Fuji in background. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: Soshu Shichirigahama ・・ｸ・ｷ・・ｸ・・・・・ｿｱ (Shichirigahama Beach, Sagami Province) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. One of two views from series, part of first group of five designs printed in Berlin blue. Shichiri-ga-hama in foreground, Enoshima with massive trees and houses in Koshigoe village in middle-ground, Mt Fuji covered by snow in distance; cumulonimbus clouds rise on horizon. Trimmed on all sides except right. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: shunga / painting
Description: Shunga. Man seducing a young woman, with shamisen on the floor behind. Hand-coloured woodblock print, with green background.

Title: Solitude
Description: Woodblock print. Portfolio cover for 'Solitude', a series of 11 woodblock prints by Matsubara Naoko. Annotation and seal.

Title: shunga / painting / handscroll
Description: No: 6. Painting, handscroll, shunga. Ten scenes of lovemaking; probably courtesans and their customers at pleasure quarters. Ink, colour and mica on paper. Trimmed?

Title: painting / fan
Description: Fan leaf. Cock and chick. Ink on paper.

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Painting. Woman at her toilet. According to reg. signed.

Title: Fujin Sogaku Jittai (Ten Types in the Physiognomic Study of Women)
Description: Woodblock print. Bijinga. Woman with left hand tucking handkerchief in her obi and gesturing with her right hand. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: No. 4 Noshima no sekisho ・・・・・・・ｶ・・・ｮ・､・・・ｧ (No. 4 Evening Glow at Noshima) / Kamakura hakkei ・・・・・・・ｫ・・ｯ (Eight Views of Kamakura)
Description: Woodblock print with hand-colouring. Fourth of series. Evening glow at Noshima; with boats, offshore islands and Shinto shrines; in fan-shaped frame. With poem. Inscribed, signed and marked.

Title: painting / handscroll
Description: Makimono. (According to reg. a pair). Street scene. The Fire in Edo, and After the Fire. Ink and colours on silk.

Title: Kintarﾅ・ rigyo o toru ・・・・､ｪ・・・・・・・ｯ・・ｭ・ (Kintarﾅ・ Captures the Carp)
Description: Colour woodblock print, vertical diptych. Strong boy Kintaro (also called Kaidomaru) wrestling a giant carp at the base of a waterfall. Clear glue applied to the eyes to give them lustre (original to the print). Two sheets pasted together.

Title: print
Description: Colour woodblock print. The Kabuki actor Arashi Kichisaburﾅ・ II (Rikan) as Akizuki Daizen, in the play 'Sono no yuki koi no kumidai' ・・・・・ｪ・・・・ｵ・・｡・ at the Naka theatre. Second month, 1816.

Title: mitate-e / painting / hanging scroll
Description: Hanging scroll. Courtesan approaching house with musical party. Ink and colours on silk.

Title: Onchi Koshiro zo (Portrait of Onchi Koshiro) / Ichimoku-shu (First Thursday Collection, Vol 1)
Description: Colour woodblock print. Portrait of Onchi Koshiro. Annotations and seal.

Title: The Flying: Ketsu (The Flying: Conclusion)
Description: Woodblock and intaglio print. Flying chickens and falling timbers. Annotation.

Title: The Flying: Ten (The Flying: Turn)
Description: Woodblock and intaglio print. Flying chickens and falling timbers. Annotation.

Title: The Flying: Sho (The Flying: Development)
Description: Woodblock and intaglio print. Flying chickens and falling timbers. Annotation.

Title: The Flying: Ki (The Flying: Introduction)
Description: Woodblock and intaglio print. Flying chickens and falling timbers. Annotation.

Title: Azuma nishiki matsu no kurai ・・ｱ・・ｦ・､ｪ・､ｫ・・ｮ・ｽ・ (Courtesans in Brocades of the East)
Description: Illustrated book, print. 1 vol. (incomplete). Scenes of courtesans. Colour woodblock-printed.

Title: Onoe Matsusuke I as Yuasa Magoroku and Ichikawa Komazo III as Nitta Yoshisada ・・・・ｻ｣・ｰｾ・ｸ・・・ｾ・・ｩ・・ｮ・ｹｯ・ｵ・・ｭｫ・・ｭ・・ｨ・ｸ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｸ・・ｷ・・ｫ・・ｺ・・・ｵ・・ｮ・・ｰ・・ｰ・ｾｩ・ｲ・
Description: Diptych woodblock print from an album of 38 sheets. Actors Ichikawa Komazo and Onoe Matsusuke.

Title: Fumi no kiyogaki ・・・・・ｮ・ｸ・・・ｸ・・・ (Clean Draft of a Love Letter, or Pure Drawings of Female Beauty)
Description: Shunga. No. 1. Courtesan with a Dutchman (fragment). Woodblock-printed

Title: Furyu mitsu no koma・・｢ｨ・ｵ・・ｸ・・・・・・ｮ・ｧ・ (A Fashionable Presentation of Three Young Ponies)
Description: Colour woodblock print. Small girl, in kimono decorated with lucky treasure pattern, dancing with shell clappers under her feet; next to her, woman seated and playing shamisen; three women standing and kneeling down behind them. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed and signed.

Title: Komyo bijin mitate Chushingura juni-dan tsuzuki ・ｫ・・・・・ｾ・・ｺｺ・ｦ・・・・・・ｦ・ｿ・・｣・・ｵ・・・・ｺ・・ｮｵ・・､・・･・・・ (Renowned Beauties Viewed As the Twelve Acts of Chushingura)
Description: Colour woodblock print, left sheet of diptych print, mitate-e. Eleventh (last) scene from series on play 'Chushingura'. Utamaro as one of play's male characters, surrounded by adored women. Inscribed and signed.

Title: Haru no yama-mata ・・･・・・・ｱｱ・・・ (Spring Mountains)
Description: Colour woodblock-printed diptych, surimono. Scenes from childhood of Kintaro: shaking tree down in front of torrent; tengu falling out of tree; Yamauba seated by tree; Yorimitsu arriving at top right. With poems. Nishiki-e on paper with applied metal dust. Inscribed and signed.

Title: Ichikawa Monnosuke II as Yoshimine no Yasusada, Seagawa Kikunojo III as the courtesan Sumizome, Otani Hiroji III as the servant Shikishima Wakahei ・ｺ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｸ・・ｷ・・・・ｹ・・・ｩ・・ｮ・・ｯ・ｲ・・・ｮ・ｮ・・ｲ・・・・ｸ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｬ・ｷ・・・・・ｹ・・ｸ・・・ｮ・・ｾ・・・・｢ｨ・・・・・・ｸ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・､ｧ・ｰｷ・ｺ・・ｬ｡・・ｮ・ｸ・・・ｨ・・ｷ・ｳｶ・・・・ｭ・・ｹｳ
Description: Woodblock print, triptych. Kabuki. Actors Ichikawa Monnosuke as gentleman with falcon, Segawa Kikujiro as courtesan and Bando Hiroji as retainer, in tent. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: triptych print
Description: Colour woodblock print triptych. Poetry meeting at night: scene at exclusive restaurant or private house; priest and two samurai reading poetry in upper room; another participant being led off by staff. Signed, sealed and marked.

Title: uki-e / triptych print
Description: Woodblock, triptych. General subject - history, myth, legend, uki-e. Fight at Kurosaki Castle between warrior heroes Toyama Saemon Munemochi and Makino Arataro Munesumi,+ their adversaries. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: Seiro kabuki yatsushi e-zukushi, juban-tsuzuki・・・・・･ｼ・ｭ・・・・・ｦ・・・・・・､・・・・・ｻ・ｰｽ・・・・・・ｪ・ｶ・ (Casual Depictions of Kabuki in Yoshiwara, a Ten-print Series)
Description: Colour woodblock-printed triptych. Courtesan Yosooi of Matsubaya gathered together with assistants beneath flowering cherry trees at Naka-no-cho; assistant on left sheet carrying doll modelled on Kabuki actor Ichikawa Danjuro VI in role of swashbuckling champion of oppressed, Sukeroku. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed, marked and sealed.

Title: Asagao ・・・・｡・ (Morning Glory) / Furyu yatsushi Genji ・｢ｨ・ｵ・・・・・・､・・・・ｺ・・ｰ・ (Stylishly Casual Genji)
Description: Colour woodblock-printed triptych, benigirai-e. One design from series of ten. Hikaru Genji indulging in exchange of poems with Lady Asagao in centre sheet; morning glory in bloom in left sheet. Inscribed, signed and marked.

Title: Nakamura Nakazo I as Sekimori Sekibei, Ichikawa Monnosuke II as Yoshimine no Munesada and Segawa Kikunojo III as Ono no Komachi (・・・・ｻ｣・ｸｭ・・・・ｻｲ・・ｵ・・ｮ・・｢・ｮ・・・｢・・ｵ・｡・・・・ｺ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｸ・・ｷ・・・・ｹ・・・ｩ・・ｮ・・ｯ・ｲ・・ｮ・・ｲ・・・・ｸ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｬ・ｷ・・・・・ｹ・・ｸ・・・ｮ・ｰ・・・・・ｰ・・・ｺ)
Description: Woodblock print. Kabuki. Three actors, Nakamura Denkuro as woodman with axe, Segawa Kikunojo as girl with flowers, Ichikawa Monnosuke as poet with tanzaku. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: print
Description: Woodblock print. Kabuki. Figures of actors as a man and a woman carrying a bundle of faggots on her head, Sawamura Gennosuke (?). Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: Morita Kanya VIII as Sadakuro and Yoichibei ・・ｫ・ｻ｣・・ｮ・｣ｮ・・ｰ・・・・ｼ･・・ｮ・ｮ・・ｹ・・・・・・ｨ・ｸ・・ｸ・・・ｵ・｡・
Description: Colour woodblock print, hosoban. The kabuki actor Morita Kanya VIII performing a ・・quick-change・・ of role (・・hayagawari・・) inside a large bale of rice, from the character of Yoichibei on the right, to Ono Sadakuro on the left, in the play ・・Ichikawa Danzo mach

Title: print
Description: Colour woodblock print. Actor Ichikawa Danjuro V as deity Fudo Myo-o of Narita, standing on rock in waterfall, surrounded by flames, holding sword to quell evil and rope to snare wrongdoersm. Nishiki-e on paper. Signed.

Title: triptych print
Description: Colour woodblock print triptych. Newly published brocade first night: Audience arriving at Kabuki theatre; three women on right wearing hair-cloths; man carrying boxes of noodles on left; two doormen standing with fans advertising appearance of Danjuro (left) and Sojuro (right); performance glimpse through entrance. 1 of 2 impressions. Inscribed and signed.

Title: (Shinpan Oranda uki-e) Yoroppa-shu sekizokyo mokudo jinkyo (・・ｰ・・・・・ｿ・・ｭ・・・ｵｮ・ｵｵ) ・ｬｧ・・・・ｷｴ・ｴｲ・・ｳ・・ｾ・・・ｨ・・・・ｺｺ・ｽ｢ (The Stone Edifice and Figure of Jupiter in Europe (A Newly Published Dutch Uki-e))
Description: Woodblock print. Uki-e. Puppets representing Europeans in a Western-style banqueting hall. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: Fujikake Shizuya hakushi zo (Portrait of Dr Fujikake Shizuya)
Description: Monochrome wood engraving. Artist's proof. Man in kimono seated next to 'hibachi' (charcoal brazier) with tea-pot; open album of Venetian views on table; in traditional Japanese room with folding screens and cabinet. Signed, inscribed and dated.

Title: panel / painting
Description: Painting, hanging scroll mounted on a panel. Courtesan and kamuro. Ink, colour and gold on paper.

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Hanging scroll. Dancer. Ink and colours on paper.

Title: painting / handscroll
Description: Makimono. Theatre. Scenes from the life of an actress. Ink and colours on paper.

Title: Mitate sanjﾅｫrokkasen no uchi ・ｦ・・ｫ・・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・ｭ・・・ｰ・ｹ・・・・ ([Kabuki Roles] Seen As the Anthology of Thirty-Six Immortal Poets)
Description: Print, colour woodblock. Mitsuhide・・s wife Satsuki ・・・・ｧ・ｦｻ・・・・・､・・・ portrayed by the actor Onoe Kikujirﾅ・ II and associated with a poem by Sﾅ・jﾅ・ Henjﾅ・.

Title: triptych print
Description: Colour woodblock-printed triptych. Pleasure-boat on Sumida River: Actors with courtesans and entertainers carried on river; townspeople crowd in small boats to try to see them; trained monkey dancing to music of shamisen and drums on board. Signed.

Title: Joruri mutsumashizuki koi no tedori ・ｵ・・・・・・・・・ｸ・ｼ・・・ｦ・ｼ・・・・・・・・・・・・・ (The Crafty Art of New Year's Love)
Description: Colour woodblock pillar print. Actors Segawa Kikunojo III and Iwai Hanshiro IV as maidens in 'Harugoma' dance in joruri play 'Mutsumashi-tsuki koi no tetori'. Inscribed, signed, marked and sealed.

Title: print
Description: Colour woodblock print with powdered mica ground. Actors Nakayama Tomisaburo as Umegawa and Ichikawa Komazo as her lover Chubei; walking under umbrella. 1 of 2 impressions. Signed, sealed and marked.

Title: Shiri-tori-ne Nashi Kusagusa
Description: Triptych: A comic representation, gi-ga (drawn for fun), showing numerous figures engaged in various activities portraying legends, heroes, and stories, among others: (right sheet)--top left, torisashi (bird catcher), top middle, yamagaeri (returning from the mountain)(a pilgrim on Mount Fuji), top right, Mongaku Shonin under the waterfall, middle right, tsuibi yakko (a following servant), bottom right, Aoto genen (servants of Aoto (a dramatic character)), below, the nobleman and poet Ono no Tofu standing on a bridge, to the left, O-Han carried across a stream by Taira no Kanemochi, above them, Urashima Taro with his fishing rod amuses Yebisu the god of good luck; (center sheet)-top right, Honzo, from the Chushingura, top left, Chokichi, below, the painter Ukiyo Matabei, seated, behind is Daikoku, another god of good luck, with his mallet and sack, admiring a fountain of gold coins issuing from a rice mortar tended by a courtesan, middle left, a dancing shojo (drunken sprite) with a sake cup, middle right, Umegaye, below, Shibata Katsuie breaking the water jar, from which a Chinese child (kara-ko) escapes, the event being watched by three Buddhist divinities; (left sheet)- top right, Oniwaka Maru about to attack a a giant paper carp (on which Kinko, the sennin is riding) mounted on a long pole carried by the strong boy Kintaro, top left, Noritsune (not Nasu no Yoichi executing his master shot at the battle of Ichi-no Tano (Yashima)), below, the bandit monk Kumasaka Chohan, below, Jo and Uba, spirits of the pine-tree, right, Yoshitsune dressed as a travelling monk, bottom Raiko (Yorimitsu) also dressed as a travelling monk encounters an old woman (Takesago) on his way to slay Shuten Doji, bottom right edge, Yanada Yoichi.

Title: Sashu rukei Kakuta nami daimoku ・ｽ・・ｷ・・ｵ・・・・・ｧ・・・ｰ・ｳ｢・｡・・・ｮ (Banishment to Sado Island: Sutra Title on the Waves at Kakuta) / Koso go-ichidai ryaku-zu ・ｫ・・･・・ｾ｡・ｸ・ｻ｣・・･・・・ (Brief Illustrated History of Life of the Great Monk)
Description: Woodblock print. Nichiren calming storm on his way to Sado; with large waves. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, sealed, marked and signed.

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: COMPASS Image Caption: Benzaiten, a hanging scroll painting

Title: kakemono-e
Description: Large vertical colour woodblock print (kakemono-e), in original paper mounting as a hanging scroll. High-ranking courtesan processing.

Title: Yuki no Shirahige ・・ｪ・・ｮ・・ｽ・・ｲ・・・ (Shirahige in the Snow) / Tokyo junidai ・・ｱ・ｺｬ・・・・ｺ・・｡・ (Twelve Tokyo Subjects)

Title: Nakayama Kojuro VI as Chobei, an Izu pilgrim, in reality Osada no Taro Kagemune, Sawamura Sojuro III as Komatsu no Shigemori (・・ｭ・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｸｭ・ｱｱ・ｰ・・・・・・・・・ｮ・ｼ・・ｱ・・・ｮ・・・､ｼ・・ｷ・・ｵ・｡・・ｮ・・・ｯ・・ｷ・・ｰ・・ｮ・､ｪ・・・・・ｯ・ｮ・・・・ｸ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｲ｢・・・・ｮ・・・・・・・・・ｮ・ｰ・・・ｾ・・ｮ・・・・・・)
Description: Woodblock print. Kabuki. Actors as Tadamori and the lamp-lighter of Gion Temple, Kyoto, in play. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: triptych print
Description: Woodblock print, triptych. Kabuki. Popular culture. Actors, Seven Gods of Good Luck, boat. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: surimono / print
Description: Extra large colour woodblock print, surimono. Cloth banner painted with bristling scarlet figure of actor Ichikawa Danjuro VII as Shoki; large paper carp kite (koi-nobori) flying behind. With poems. Signed, sealed and inscribed.

Title: triptych print
Description: Woodblock print, triptych. Kabuki. Kagamiyama play scene,actors Ichikawa Danjuro as Iwafuji,Iwai Hanshiro as O-Hatsu,Iwai Shijaku as Onoe,by temple. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: Edo shi-ire Otsu miyage・・ｱ・・・ｸ・ｻ・・・･・､ｧ・ｴ･・・・・・｣ (Souvenir Paintings from Otsu, Stocked in Edo)
Description: Colour woodblock print. Shaving Fukurokuju from a ladder; dog grabbed end of blind man's loincloth in its mouth and unravelling it. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed and signed.

Title: Shinpan morokoshi kyusenzan kassen no zu ・・ｰ・・ｿ・・・・ｹ・・ｻ・・ｱｱ・・・・・ｦ・ｹ・・・・ (Newly published picture of Chinese battle at Nine Hermit Mountain)
Description: Colour woodblock-printed diptych. uki-e. Chinese battle at Nine Hermit Mountain; from puppet play by Chikamatsu Monzaemon, 'Kokusenya kassen'. Inscribed and signed.

Title: Shonenko ・ｰ・・ｹｴ・｡・ (The Youth's Song) / Shiika shashin kyo ・ｩｩ・・･・・ｩ・・・・・｡ (True Mirror of Chinese and Japanese Poems)
Description: Colour woodblock print. One from series of ten prints based on well-known Chinese and Japanese poems. Cui Guofu on horseback using willow-branch as whip; man with umbrella-hat fishing on bank. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed, marked and sealed.

Title: Zoi-cho ・｢・・｡｣・ｸ・ (Album of Gift Prints)
Description: Album, woodblock prints. 109 erotic surimono, mostly calendar prints. In chitsu (case) with title-slip.  Sheet 1.

Title: Kanda Kon'ya-cho ・･・・・ｰ・ｴｺ・ｱ・・・ｺ (Dyers' Quarter, Kanda) / Meisho Edo hyakkei ・・・・・・ｱ・・・ｸ・・ｾ・・ｯ (One Hundred Famous Views of Edo)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Long strips of dyed cotton cloth hanging from high drying frames in Kon'ya-cho; Strips of white cloth decorated with patters; slight breeze through bottom of hanging strips; solitary bird flying in sky; Mt Fuji in distance. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed, sealed and marked.

Title: drawing
Description: Sketch. Male street performer dancing with lion mask and fan. Ink on paper.

Title: screen / painting
Description: COMPASS Image Caption: Panels 4-6

Description: Sketch, keyblock ('hanshita-e') for unpublished print. Reeds being transported on two-wheeled cart. Ink on paper. With poem. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: Chunagon Kanesuke ・ｸｭ・ｴ・・ｨ・・ｼ・ｼ・ / Hyakunin isshu uba ga etoki ・・ｾ・ｺｺ・ｸ・ｦ・・ｧ･・・・・・・・・ｨ・・・ (One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets, Explained by the Nurse)
Description: Sketch, keyblock ('hanshita-e') for unpublished print. Ferry with passengers on board. With poem. Ink on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: mitate-e / painting / hanging scroll
Description: Hanging scroll. Youth and girl representing Cho Ryo and Koseki Ko. Ink and colours on paper.

Title: Mane'emon No.2 ・・ｾ・・ｭ・・ｸ・・・・・・・ｺ・ / Furyu enshoku Mane'emon ・｢ｨ・ｵ・・・ｶ・・ｲ・・・・ｼｼ・・・・・・・・・ (Elegant Amorous Mane'emon)
Description: Shunga. Young woman seduced by her calligraphy teacher. Woodblock-printed. Inscribed.

Title: print
Description: Colour woodblock print. Bijinga. Ohisa of Takashimaya at her shop; with two seated guests on bench, lantern and curtains; with poems. Nishiki-e on paper. Signed, inscribed and marked.

Title: Joshoku kaiko tewaza-gusa, shi, go, roku・・･ｳ・ｹ・・・・・・・・･ｭ・・・・・・・~・・ｭ (Women Engaged in the Sericulture Industry, Nos. 4-6)
Description: Colour woodblock-printed triptych. Three sheets from twelve-sheet composition. Three stages of silk production by female workers: Re-activating worms after sleep, feeding larvae with mulberry leaves, putting cocoons on trays. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and marked.

Title: Joshoku kaiko tewaza-gusa, ichi, ni, san・・･ｳ・ｹ・・・・・・・・･ｭ・・・・・｣ｱ~・ｸ・ (Women Engaged in the Sericulture Industry, Nos. 1-3)
Description: Colour woodblock-printed triptych. Three sheets from twelve-sheet composition. Three stages of silk production by female workers: laying eggs; collecting mulberry leaves; feeding of silk worms. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and marked.

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Hanging scroll. Geisha with samisen. Ink and colours on silk.

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Hanging scroll. Woman with lanterns and flowering tree. Ink and colours on silk.

Title: painting / hanging scroll / diptych
Description: Hanging scroll, painting, right of diptych. Two geishas: woman standing and carrying metal sake kettle on stand; another woman seated and leaning on metal tobacco pipe. Ink-colour and gold on silk. Signed and sealed.

Title: screen / painting
Description: River festival at Nagoya with boats and city scenes. Ink and colours and gold on paper.

Description: Colour woodblock print. Two geishas performing 'manzai' performance: Tayu role dancing in court-hat and voluminous robes with fan; Manzai role wearing court-hat and playing hand-drum. Nishiki-e on paper. Signed, inscribed, sealed and marked.

Title: Mane'emon no. 5 ・・ｾ・・ｭ・・ｸ・・・・・・・ｺ・ / Furyu enshoku Mane'emon ・｢ｨ・ｵ・・・ｶ・・ｲ・・・・ｼｼ・・・・・・・・・ (Elegant Amorous Mane'emon)
Description: Colour woodblock print. Two male lovers on a futon behind a folding screen.

Title: Kanagawa-oki nami-ura ・･・・･・・ｷ・・ｲ・・ｵｪ・｣・ (Under the Wave off Kanagawa) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. 'The Great Wave'; fishermen cowering in three skiffs, wave about to crash down on them, Mt Fuji seen low in hollow of wave. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed and signed.

Title: Onmayagashi yori Ryogoku-bashi no sekiyo o miru ・ｾ｡・・ｩ・ｷ・・ｲｸ・・・・・・・ｸ｡・・ｽ・ｩ・・､・・・ｽ・ｦ・ (Viewing Sunset over Ryogoku Bridge from the Onmaya Embankment) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Ferryboat setting out from Honjo district to cross Sumida River to Ommaya-gashi; passengers (including samurai, pedlars, nursing mother, blind man, monk (or nun), bird-catcher with his long, lime-covered pole and boatman) looking over water towards evening silhouette of Mt Fuji on horizon; pleasure boats gathering at Ryogoku bridge downstream; trees surrounding government rice warehouses on far bank to right. 1 of 2 impressions. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed, sealed and marked.

Title: Gohyaku Rakan-ji Sazai-do ・ｺ・・・ｾ・・・・・・・・・・ｯｺ・・・・・・・・・・・ｩ・・・ (Turban Shell Hall of the Five Hundred Arhat Temple) / Fugaku sanjurokkei ・・ｨ・ｶｽ・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｯ (Thirty-six Views of Mt. Fuji)
Description: Woodblock. The Turban Shell Hall of the Five Hundred Arhat Temple. 1 of 2. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: diptych print
Description: Colour woodblock-printed diptych, mitate-e. Six celebrated beauties of day likened to the Six Immortal Poets of the Heian period; each with poem. Nishiki-e on paper, with white mica. Inscribed and signed.

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Hanging scroll. Deity. Fukurokuju and emblems of longevity. Colours on silk. According to the catalogue, signed and seal.

Title: Toei ・・｣・ｰｸ (Toei) / Nijushi-ko doji kagami ・ｺ・・・・・・・・ｭ・・ｫ･・ｭ・・・・ (Twenty Four Children, Paragons of Filial Piety)
Description: First-stage preparatory drawing for woodblock print (shita-e). Toei bidding farewell to Heavenly Weaver; Chinese-style gate and Western sailing ship in background; rider on horseback on verso; with pentimenti. Ink on paper. For finished print, see 1934,1013,0.29.

Title: screen / painting
Description: Screen. (According to reg. two paintings in screen). Party of dancers by river. Ink and colours on silk.

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Screen. Woman kneeling. Ink and colours on paper.

Title: Ichikawa Komazo III ・ｸ・・ｻ｣・・ｮ・ｸ・・ｷ・・ｫ・・ｺ・・・ｵ / Yakusha butai no sugata-e ・ｽｹ・・・・・・・ｰ・ｹ・・ｧｿ・ｵｵ (Pictures of Actors on Stage) (Pictures of Actors on the Stage)
Description: Woodblock print. Kabuki. Actor Ichikawa Komazo known as Matsumoto Koshiro. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: Shirokiya Okoma, Obana Saizaburo・・・・・・・・ｱ・・・・・ｧ・・・ｰｾ・・ｱ・・・・ｸ・・・・ (Shirokiya Okoma and Obana Saizaburo) / Jitsu kurabe iro no minakami・・ｮ・・ｫｶ・・ｲ・ｹ・・ｾ・・・・・ｮｶ・ｦ・ (True Feelings Compared: The Founts of Love)
Description: Woodblock: print. Shirokiya Okoma and Obana Saizaburo. (Or Umegawa and Chubei?).

Description: Shunga. (No.9 -- Lane). Lovers behind a folding screen. Woodblock-printed

Description: Shunga. (No.10 -- Lane). Lovers and unravelled obi. Woodblock-printed

Title: Ehon tsuhi no hinagata ・ｵｵ・・ｬ・・､・・ｲ・・ｮ・・・・ｽ｢ (Picture-book Models of Couples)
Description: Shunga. (No.10 -- Lane). Lovers and unravelled obi. Woodblock-printed. According to register, signed.

Title: print
Description: Colour woodblock print. Gonpachi tying cord of his black jacket in preparation to return home; his lover courtesan Komurasaki trying to stop him by kneeling at his feet and tugging at his sleeve. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and marked.

Title: print
Description: Woodblock print. Kabuki. Large head of actor as Yamauba. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: Shodan・・・・・ｮｵ (Act One) / Chushingura・・ｿ・・｣・・ｵ (Treasury of the Loyal Retainers)
Description: Colour woodblock print. First composition of twelve designs. Villain Ko no Moronao in bottom right-hand corner, infatuating with Enya Hangan's wife Kaoyo and trying to force love-letter on her; Kaoyo herself above, starting back in dismay;  young lord Momoi Wakasanosuke at bottom left, coming to her aid. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed, sealed and marked.

Title: uki-e / triptych print
Description: Woodblock print, triptych. Inside a kabuki theatre, actors on stage. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: tea-screen / painting
Description: COMPASS Title: Maruyama Okyo, Nine Old Men of Mt. Xiang, a 2-fold screen painting

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Painting. Girl seated on peach tree.

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Painting, hanging scroll. Woman collecting mushrooms: woman holding mushrooms strung on stalk of grass and gazing up at bright orange foliage of maple tree; with black kimono decorated with discreet band of seasonal bushclover pattern around hem and scarlet under-kimono vied with autumn leaves. Ink, colour and gold on paper. Signed and sealed.

Title: print / photographic print
Description: Six photographs of Onchi Koshiro, Ernst Hacker and their circle, 1943-46

Title: Musashi Chofu ・ｭｦ・・ｵ・ｪｿ・ｸ・ (Chofu in Musashi Province) / Shokoku mu-tamagawa ・ｫｸ・・・・・ｭ・・・・ｷ・ (Six Jewel Rivers in Various Provinces)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Riverside view at Chofu: Country women pounding cloth in large mortar and rinsing it in river; in background more women drying cloth by laying it on ground and hanging it from high drying frame; Mt Fuji in distance. With poem. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: Momochidori kyoka awase ・・ｾ・・・・ｳ･・・・・ｭ・・・・ (Myriad Birds: A Kyoka Competition)
Description: Illustrated book, folding album, colour woodblock print. 2 volumes. Poetry contest on theme of birds. Covers: Original, yellow, ?stencil-printed with darker yellow peonies. Title slips: Original, printed on yellow slips pasted in top left corner of covers. Contents: (vol. 1) 10 leaves: 1 double-page preface, 8 double-page illustrations of birds and flowers, 1 double page of advertisement and publisher's colophon; (vol. 2) 9 leaves: 1 double-page preface, 7 double-page illustrations of birds and flowers, 1 double page of advertisement and publisher's colophon (same as vol 1). Illustrations and makes of poets (Vol 1, each page described right to left): 1. Quail (uzura), Tsuburi Hikaru. Skylark (hibari), Zeniya Kinrachi; 2. Penduline tit (yamagara), Ki no Sadamaru. Bush warbler (uguisu), Sunawachi Yuyu; 3. Barn swallow (tsubame), Sakezuki no Komendo. Male pheasant (kiji), Kiri Hitoha; 4. Yellow-billed grosbeak (mamemawashi), Akera Kanko. Male white-backed pecker (kitsutsuki), Shino no Tamawaku; 5. Long-tailed tit (enaga), Magaki no Kikumaru. Japanese white-eye (mejiro), Tawara Funazumi; 6. Copper pheasant (yamadori), Monaka no Tsukimaro. White wagtail (sekirei), Mantokusai; 7. Winter wren (misosazai), Karagoromo Kisshu. Snipe (shigi), Senkyaku Banrai; 8. Domestic fowl (niwatori), Yadoya no Meshimori. Meadow bunting (hojiro), Ashibe Tazumaru. (Vol 2): 9. Scops owl (mimizuku), Ichi no Nakazumi. Bullfinch (uso), Sasaha no Suzunari; 10. Cormorant (u), Torai Sanna. Egret (sagi), Shikatsube no Magao; 11. Great tit (shijukara), Takara no Atsumaru. Japanese robin (komadori), Fumoto no Chikamichi; 12. Tree sparrow (murasuzume), Aya no Orinushi. Rock dove (hato), Sono no Kocho; 13. Jay (kashidori), Oya no Urazumi. Boreal owl (fukuro), Shingoken Birin; 14. Mallard (kamo), Honen Yukimaru. Common kingfisher (kawasemi), Sandara Boshi; 15. Goshawk (taka), Akamatsu Kinkei. Thick-billed shrike (mozu), Hyakkisai. With gauffrage. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: COMPASS Image Caption: Minamoto no Yoritomo in court dress, a hanging scroll painting

Title: triptych print
Description: Woodblock print, triptych. Kabuki. Thirteen famous actors sheltering from the rain under ginkgo tree, one of the female impersonators on a black ox. Nishiki-e on paper.

Title: shunga / painting / handscroll
Description: No: 2. Painting, handscroll, shunga. Erotic scenes: Couples making love. Ink colour and gold on silk. Signed and sealed. With paulownia storage box.

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Hanging-scroll. Young woman and her maid out walking. Ink and colours and gold on paper. Signed and sealed.

Title: Yakusha sanjurokkasen ・ｿｳ・・・・ｸ・・・・・・ｭ・・ｱ・・ｰ (Thirty-six Flowers of the Acting Profession)
Description: Illustrated book. Portraits of actors, accompanied by haiku poems. 1 vol (of orig. 3). Published.

Title: Gin sekai ・・・ｸ・・・・ (The Silver World) / Setsu gekka ・・ｪ・・・・・ｱ (Snow, Moon and Flowers)
Description: Illustrated book.  Woodblock-printed. folding album, colour wood block print. 1 vol. for snow from series of "Snow, Moon and Flowers". Seventy-eight poems all on theme of snow. Covers: Dark blue, painted in gold with horizontal bands of mist and willow tree. Title slip: Original, printed on buff slip pasted in top left corner of cover. Contents: 10 leaves: 1 double-page preface, 5 double-page illustrations, 3 double pages of poems, 1 double page of poem and publisher's colophon. Illustrations: 1. Embankment of Sumida River in  snow; 2. Chinese boys in  snow; 3. Pulling a boat in snow; 4. Court scene in snow [Sei Shonagon]; 5. Party scene on  snowy night. With brass dust and gauffrage. Inscribed, signed and sealed.

Title: panel / painting
Description: Painting, hanging scroll, mounted on panel. Formal procession of grand courtesan to a teahouse in Nakanocho, Yoshiwara, accompanied by two apprentices, girl and boy attendants, and elderly couple; on teahouse platform, another courtesan chats with teahous

Title: Utamakura ・ｭ・・・ｾ・・・・・・ (Poem of the Pillow)
Description: Shunga, colour woodblock-printed album leaf. Lovers in the upstairs room of a restaurant, poem on the fan.

Title: painting / handscroll / board

Description: Erotic illustrated book, shunga  Folding album.  Woodblock with slight colour.  By painters of Kyoto and Osaka, particularly artists of the Maruyama-Shijo and related schools.

Title: Genji goshu yojo ・ｺ・・ｰ・・ｾ・・・・・ｽ・・・・ (Lasting Impressions of a Late Genji Collection) / Hattan: Ishiyamadera Genji no ma ・・ｺ・ｫｯ・ｼ・・・ｳ・ｱｱ・ｯｺ・ｺ・・ｰ・・・ｮ・・・ (Frontispiece: The Genji Room at Ishiyama Temple)
Description: Colour woodblock print with special printing effects, such as embossing and textile-weave printing.  Murasaki Shikibu writing the Tale of Genji.    Frontispiece to a group of 38 diptychs comprising all the known designs from the series Genji goshu yojo (L

Title: Genji goshu yojo ・ｺ・・ｰ・・ｾ・・・・・ｽ・・・・ (Lasting Impressions of a Late Genji Collection) / Sanjuhachi no maki: Suzumushi ・ｸ・・・・・・ｫ・・ｮ・ｷｻ: ・・ｴ・・・・・ (Chapter 38: The Bell Cricket)
Description: Colour woodblock diptych print with special printing effects, such as embossing and textile-weave printing.  Thirty-third in a group of 38 diptychs plus one frontispiece comprising all the known designs from the series Genji goshu yojo (Lasting Impressions of a Late Genji Collection; 1857-61).  Based on the serialized novel Nise Murasaki inaka Genji (A Country Genji by a Fake Murasaki; chapters 1-38, published 1829-42) by Ryutei Tanehiko, and its sequel Sono yukari hina no omokage (A Related Rustic Visage; chapters 39-61, published1847-64) by Tanehiko's followers.  Both novels illustrated by Utagawa Kunisada (Toyokuni III).

Title: painting / hanging scroll
Description: Painting, kakemono. Young samurai seated on a bench. Ink and colours on silk.

Title: Yamabe no Akahito ・ｱｱ・・ｨ・・ｮ・ｵ､・ｺｺ / Hyakunin isshu uba ga etoki ・・ｾ・ｺｺ・ｸ・ｦ・ ・ｮ・・ｳ｢・・・・・・・・ｨ・・・ (One Hundred Poems by One Hundred Poets, Explained by the Nurse)
Description: Colour woodblock oban print. Travellers climbing steep gradient on coastal path; one person carried in sedan chair; another man turning back to those following; Mt Fuji coated with snow across Suruga Bay. With poem by Yamabe no Akahito. Trimmed slightly on all sides. Nishiki-e on paper. Inscribed, signed and sealed.
